intro: Oenone guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana milkweed, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they bloom in the summer months. The plant's latex contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
